data.name: DateTimeIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput DateTime DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = convert(DateTime, '1999-12-31 11:59:00 PM') SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant

data.name: DateTimeOffsetIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput datetimeoffset DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = convert(datetimeoffset, '0001-01-01 11:59:00 PM') SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant

data.name: TinyIntIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput tinyint DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = 255 SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant AND @testVar.Type = 'SqlByte'

data.name: SmallIntIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput SmallInt DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = 32767 SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant AND @testVar.Type = 'SqlInt16'

data.name: IntIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput int DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = 2147483647 SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant AND @testVar.Type = 'SqlInt32'

data.name: BigIntIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput bigint DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = 9223372036854775807 SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant AND @testVar.Type = 'SqlInt64'

data.name: BitIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput bit = 1 DECLARE @testVar BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant AND @testVar.Type = 'SqlBoolean'

data.name: FloatIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput float(24) DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = 0.1 SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testInput AND @testVar.Type = 'SqlSingle'

data.name: DoubleIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput float = 1.79E+308 DECLARE @testVar BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant

data.name: CompareAllNumericTypes_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value:
declare @bitVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(bit, 1)) declare @tinyintVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(tinyint, 1)) declare @smallintVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(smallint, 1)) declare @intVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(int, 1)) declare @bigintVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(bigint, 1)) declare @floatVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(float(24), 1)) declare @doubleVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(float, 1)) declare @decimalVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(decimal, 1)) declare @moneyVar as BigVariant = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(CONVERT(money, 1))
SELECT 'success' WHERE @bitVar.AsVariant = @tinyintvar.AsVariant AND @tinyintvar.AsVariant = @smallintVar.AsVariant AND @smallintVar.AsVariant = @intVar.AsVariant AND @intVar.AsVariant = @bigintVar.AsVariant
SELECT 'success' WHERE @floatVar.AsVariant = @doubleVar.AsVariant AND @doubleVar.AsVariant = @decimalVar.AsVariant AND @decimalVar.AsVariant = @moneyVar.AsVariant

data.name: DecimalIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput decimal DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = 922337203685477.5807 SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant AND @testVar.Type = 'SqlDecimal'

data.name: MoneyIntoBigVariant_TestAction.SqlScript
data.value: DECLARE @testInput money DECLARE @testVar BigVariant SET @testInput = 922337203685477.5807 SET @testVar = dbo.BigVariantFromVariant(@testInput) SELECT 'success' WHERE @testInput = @testVar.AsVariant AND @testVar.Type = 'SqlMoney'
